fields.value: Confirmation Wars, Legislative Time, and Collateral Damage: Assessing the Impact of Supreme Court Nominations on Presidential Success in the U.S. Senate

dsDescriptionValue.value: This page includes four datasets to replication duration models of presidential success on policy proposals and judicial nominations in the U.S. Senate. All four files contain monthly information about whether the nomination or proposal passed in the given month, along with several covariates. The two policy datasets are for "important" and "routine" legislative proposals from 1967-2010. The two nomination datasets are for circuit and district court nominees.

publicationCitation.value: Madonna, Anthony J., James E. Monogan III, and Richard L. Vining Jr. "Confirmation Wars, Legislative Time, and Collateral Damage: Assessing the Impact of Supreme Court Nominations on Presidential Success in the U.S. Senate." Political Research Quarterly.

files.description: Duration data for U.S. Circuit Court nominations, 1977-2010. There are 415 nominees in a total of 3892 nominee-months.
files.label: circuit.tab

files.description: R code to replicate the duration models of lower court nominees and of policy passage. The code also reproduces the figures reported in the manuscript.
